name: Courtyard Boston-South Boston

reviews.text: My room at the Courtyard South Boston was extremely clean as well as roomy and well appointed. The wireless internet was fast and easy to access. The fitness room was small but adequate, and all of the equipment was in good repair. Possibly the most memorable aspect of my stay was the helpfulness and courtesy of the staff. The shuttle bus drivers were kind enough to drop me off at the closest metro stop (about a 10-minute walk away) on several occasions and also pick me up from the station. I also used the complimentary airport shuttle and was pleasantly surprised by how quickly the shuttle arrived at the airport. I'll definitely consider staying here again on my next Boston trip!
reviews.title: Clean rooms, great value, excellent customer service

likes.disliked: — Breakfast left a little bit to be desired.

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in the Courtyard by Marriott South Boston, 63 R Boston Street, Boston, MA 02125, for almost two weeks in August, 2007. The staff was friendly and helpful, the price was reasonable for a large city, and the room was spacious, well maintained, clean, and had free WiFi. The subway is a five minute walk away, and a shopping mall with an Olive Garden and Chili's Restaurant is located directly behind the hotel. The shopping mall also has a Target, Circuit City, and supermarket among many other stores. Other eating places are within walking distance, but were more expensive and/or of unknown quality so we avoided them except for one which was expensive and not very good. We took the subway to the suburbs like the Harvard area or downtown for evening meals on many days and were well satisfied. We typically had breakfast in the hotel dining room which was very good, but somewhat pricey. The hotel has a shuttle service which was useful and if you tip well the drivers may stretch the rules and go well above and beyond in being helpful and getting you where you want to be!
reviews.title: Excellent value and location -- we will be back!
A great Place to Stay for young ones!
reviews.text: My wife and two young girls (6 and 9) as well as another couple with kids close to the same age arrived in Boston on Dec 30 for a couple of nights and a Boston Bruins game. After an 8 hr drive the staff at the front desk were great. They were very friendly and things were handled quickly. Our rooms were basic but clean and nice. The pool is very easy to access through the lobby and we immediately went there with 4 young ones. The pool was a little small for them, however, that was ok. (be careful though it is a little slippery on the deck...why pools do that???) The kids like the pool regardless. We felt very at ease there and even brought a few beer (in cans) to sip on while kids were in pool and we sat in hot tub.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for getting around Boston and to the game, front desk had a little direction sheet telling us how to walk to the TTC or 'T' as they call it. It was about a 10 minute walk (if that) to the 'T' and before we knew it we were at the Bruins game. Not only were the people nice at the hotel, everyone we talked to in Boston were very very friendly. After the game, some police officers gave us directins to Cheers and we had a ball! MInd you everything is a two minute walk to Boston people... perhaps the Boston Marathon mentality? A little long of a walk, but my 6 yr old handled it on a chilly New Years Eve.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay
Thumbs Up
reviews.text: The breakfast was fantastic. The nice man at the front desk gave us a deal for the first morning since we were so 'nice' haha and had such a long drive. It was a buffet and 'Mercedez', the waitress, is fantastic. Thank you for everything Mercedez! Needless to say, a very healthy and tasty breakfast.
March 10, 2008 – I had the opportunity to spend one night at the Courtyard hotel in South Boston. Every aspect of my stay met or exceeded my expectations.
reviews.title: What a nice hotel!

reviews.text: The hotel is only about 5 ½ miles South of Boston Logan Airport. However, picking up my rental car at about 5:00 PM, it took about a half hour to get to my hotel due rush hour traffic and my not being familiar with the area. A landmark to look out for when heading to the hotel is the large square storage building that tries to look like a fortress. The hotel is very close by.
reviews.title: very solid choice

reviews.text: The entrance of the hotel is dramatic, especially by Courtyard standards. There is plenty of free parking all around the hotel. Check-in was “Marriott fast,” taking less than a minute. I had reserved a King room which was guaranteed and requested a high floor. My room, #429 met both requirements. I was able to get an AAA rate of $139 per night which I thought was very good.
reviews.title: Staff was great!!

likes.liked: — friendly staff and plenty of parking

reviews.text: My room was beautiful. The décor is contemporary and comfortable. The king bed was very comfortable and had a selection of both feather and poly-fill pillows. There were night stands and wall mounted lights on each side of the bed. I appreciated the fact that there was an outlet on the lamp into which I could plug my cell phone.
reviews.title: Great Hotel , Great staff for the most part

likes.liked: — Location was good, big shopping center with restaurants next door

reviews.text: Across from the bed was a large unit which contained the clothes closet, held the TV, and was also the work desk. The TV had a large number of cable channels, but I was surprised that there was no Pay Per View programming. The desk had a very comfortable office-style chair. The hotel offers complimentary high speed internet service via a Cat 5 cable. I was able to connect to our company VPN easily. Running the Speakeasy Internet Speed Test showed a download speed of just over 1MBPS and an upload speed of about 700KBPS, reasonable fast.
reviews.title: Great Hotel but Transitional Neighborhood

reviews.text: The hotel is nice. Rooms are clean! Beware though this hotel is in a strange area. We were told that the hotel was very close to the metro station; however it is three blocks. I know this does not sound like its far, but you have to walk through a residential area and over a bridge. We had small children and felt uncomfortable coming back at night. The metro station near the hotel is not the best, smelled of urine and a little scary for families. The front desk was nice and did give us a free breakfast for not being as 'truthful' as we thought.
reviews.title: OK, but strange area

likes.liked: — The size fo the room is great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free shuttle bus from Logan airport got us off to a good start. The check in was a bit 'off hand' but over the next week we found he was the exception as the other staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was substantial and good food; the room large and very clean; the nearby restaurant 224 very good; Andrew T station less than ten minutes away so our 1 week T pass for $15 was well worth it.
reviews.title: An great base for a holiday

reviews.text: The free internet [2 computers] and hot drinks [near reception] was a nice touch. I would return to this hotel without hesitation.
reviews.title: Very good all-around hotel in a weird location

reviews.text: Stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Boston South for my first ever trip to Boston. Was looking forward to the hotel after reading the rave reviews and was prepared for the location away from downtown.
reviews.title: Suprisingly not impressed

reviews.text: The shuttle service was pretty fast at picking us up from Logan and took us straight to the hotel. We were informed that the shuttle only runs to the airport, and would not run us to downtown. However, the front desk staff had in-depth, printed directions on how to walk to the nearest train station (Andrew) which was only five minutes away.
reviews.title: A hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Modern, clean, and very comfortable. The bench in the shower is very nice touch. I loved everything about the room. The hotel has a huge lounge area with a pool table and bar. Internet capabilities in room and in the lounge area. Shuttle service which I didn't get a chance to use is very useful.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: The only drawback is that the hotel sits outside of Boston, so you would have to drive into the city, take the subway or take a cab. We took a cab at night into the city which only took about 10 minutes if that, so that's not bad at all. The neighborhood doesn't look like Beacon Hill, but their is a shopping center next door. I usually prefer to stay right in the heart of everything, but for the price it was a good bargain.
reviews.title: Very good value, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, next time I think we will stay somewhere around Copley Square or Beacon Hill, just to be in walking distance of everything.
reviews.title: Great Value Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: O yeah, I highly recommend Panificio (Charles St) for brunch.
reviews.title: More than excellent

likes.liked: — better than excellent value for the money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights. Business oriented hotel. Very clean and what you expect of a Courtyard. Rooms are decent size and clean. Staff was very helpfull and freindly. Hotel located just of I-93 south, 5 minutes south of downtown. You can also walk in less than 5 minutes to Andrew Station (subway). The hotel has a small but clean pool area. I will stay there again if going to Boston.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

description: *GPS USERS USE 7 ALLSTATE ROAD, BOSTON MA 02125. The new state-of-the-art Courtyard South Boston provides greater flexibility and choices for our guests, featuring inviting, flexible spaces to work or relax in, free high-speed Wi-Fi throughout the entire hotel & easy access to the latest news, weather and airport conditions via our GoBoard™. The highlight of our new lobby experience is The Bistro, which provides guests with healthy food and beverage offerings in the morning and evening dinner service with cocktails. Our location in “Southie” is located 4 miles from Logan International Airport (BOS), 2 miles from the city center and a heartbeat away from Boston attractions including Fenway Park, TD Bank North Garden, Freedom Trail and Quincy Market. We offer shuttle service to and from Logan Airport for an additional fee of $5.00 per person each way. For other options, Andrew Square Station is within walking distance and 3 stops from the city center.
